article:
'Orientation: A Scientology Information Film' is a 1996 short film shown by the
Church of Scientology to people before they attend their first Scientology
service. In some places, a confidentiality agreement must be signed before
watching it. {{cite web | url =
http://www.cs.cmu.edu/~dst/Scientology/ReleaseForms/ | title = Scientology's
Abusive Release Forms | accessdate = 2006-12-12
| last = Touretzky | first = David S. | authorlink = David S. Touretzky | date =
| 2003-12-11}}

It was produced by the Church's Golden Era Productions, and like all Scientology
instructional films, is based on a screenplay originally written by Scientology
founder L. Ron Hubbard. {{cite web
| url = http://www.scientology-mountainview.org/en_US/introservice/films.html
| title = Church of Scientology Mountain View: Calendar of Events/Dianetics
| Lectures | accessdate = 2006-07-16| author = Church of Scientology Mountain
| View (California)}}

The film is hosted by Larry Anderson (who left the church in 2009),
and includes uncredited testimonials by Scientologists Kirstie Alley, Anne
Archer, Chick Corea, Isaac Hayes, and John Travolta, identified only by their
occupations.

In the film's final scene, Anderson says, }}

The film is no longer screened at Scientology organizations and the official
website for Orientation has not been updated since 2006.
